t: Matthew 15
Defilement Comes from Within
Then*p the scribes and Pharisees who were from Jerusalem came to Jesus, saying,
“Why do Your disciples transgress the tradition of the elders? For they do not wash their hands when they eat bread.”
He*p answered and said to them, “Why*r do*r you*r also*r transgress*r the*r commandment*r of*r God*r because*r of*r your*r tradition?*r
For*r God*r commanded,*r saying,*r ‘Honor*r your*r father*r and*r your*r mother’;*r and,*r ‘He*r who*r curses*r father*r or*r mother,*r let*r him*r be*r put*r to*r death.’*r
But*r you*r say,*r ‘Whoever*r says*r to*r his*r father*r or*r mother,*r “Whatever*r profit*r you*r might*r have*r received*r from*r me*r is*ir a*r gift*r to*ir God”—*ir
then*r he*r need*r not*r honor*r his*r father*r or*r mother.’*r Thus*r you*r have*r made*r the*r commandment*r of*r God*r of*r no*r effect*r by*r your*r tradition.*r
Hypocrites!*r Well*r did*r Isaiah*r prophesy*r about*r you,*r saying:*r
‘These*rpn people draw*r near*r to*r Me*r with*r their*r mouth,*r And*rld honor*r Me*r with*r their*ir lips,*r But*rld their*r heart*r is*r far*r from*r Me.*r
And*rld in*r vain*r they*r worship*r Me,*r Teaching*rld as*ir doctrines*r the*r commandments*r of*r men.’”*r
When*p He had called the multitude to Himself,*i He said to them, “Hear*r and*r understand:*r
Not*r what*r goes*r into*r the*r mouth*r defiles*r a*r man;*r but*r what*r comes*r out*r of*r the*r mouth,*r this*r defiles*r a*r man.”*r
Then*p His disciples came and said to Him, “Do You know that the Pharisees were offended when they heard this saying?”
But*p He answered and said, “Every*r plant*r which*r My*r heavenly*r Father*r has*r not*r planted*r will*r be*r uprooted.*r
Let*r them*r alone.*r They*r are*r blind*r leaders*r of*r the*r blind.*r And*r if*r the*r blind*r leads*r the*r blind,*r both*r will*r fall*r into*r a*r ditch.”*r
Then*p Peter answered and said to Him, “Explain this parable to us.”
So*p Jesus said, “Are*r you*r also*r still*r without*r understanding?*r
Do*r you*r not*r yet*r understand*r that*r whatever*r enters*r the*r mouth*r goes*r into*r the*r stomach*r and*r is*r eliminated?*r
But*r those*r things*r which*r proceed*r out*r of*r the*r mouth*r come*r from*r the*r heart,*r and*r they*r defile*r a*r man.*r
For*r out*r of*r the*r heart*r proceed*r evil*r thoughts,*r murders,*r adulteries,*r fornications,*r thefts,*r false*r witness,*r blasphemies.*r
These*r are*r the*ir things*ir which*r defile*r a*r man,*r but*r to*r eat*r with*r unwashed*r hands*r does*r not*r defile*r a*r man.”*r
A Gentile Shows Her Faith
Then*p Jesus went out from there and departed to the region of Tyre and Sidon.
And behold, a woman of Canaan came from that region and cried out to Him, saying, “Have mercy on me, O Lord, Son of David! My daughter is severely demon-possessed.”
But*p He answered her not a word. And*p His disciples came and urged Him, saying, “Send her away, for she cries out after us.”
But*p He answered and said, “I*r was*r not*r sent*r except*r to*r the*r lost*r sheep*r of*r the*r house*r of*r Israel.”*r
Then*p she came and worshiped Him, saying, “Lord, help me!”
But*p He answered and said, “It*r is*r not*r good*r to*r take*r the*r children’s*r bread*r and*r throw*r it*ir to*r the*r little*r dogs.”*r
And*p she said, “Yes, Lord, yet even the little dogs eat the crumbs which fall from their masters’ table.”
Then*p Jesus answered and said to her, “O*r woman,*r great*r is*ir your*r faith!*r Let*r it*r be*r to*r you*r as*r you*r desire.”*r And her daughter was healed from that very hour.
Jesus Heals Great Multitudes
Jesus*p departed from there, skirted the Sea of Galilee, and went up on the mountain and sat down there.
Then great multitudes came to Him, having with them the*i lame, blind, mute, maimed, and many others; and they laid them down at Jesus’ feet, and He healed them.
So the multitude marveled when they saw the*i mute speaking, the*i maimed made whole, the*i lame walking, and the*i blind seeing; and they glorified the God of Israel.
Feeding the Four Thousand

Now*p Jesus called His disciples to Himself*i and said, “I*r have*r compassion*r on*r the*r multitude,*r because*r they*r have*r now*r continued*r with*r Me*r three*r days*r and*r have*r nothing*r to*r eat.*r And*r I*r do*r not*r want*r to*r send*r them*r away*r hungry,*r lest*r they*r faint*r on*r the*r way.”*r
Then*p His disciples said to Him, “Where could we get enough bread in the wilderness to fill such a great multitude?”
Jesus*p said to them, “How*r many*r loaves*r do*r you*r have?”*r And*p they said, “Seven, and a few little fish.”
So*p He commanded the multitude to sit down on the ground.
And He took the seven loaves and the fish and gave thanks, broke them*i and gave them*i to His disciples; and the disciples gave*i to the multitude.
So they all ate and were filled, and they took up seven large baskets full of the fragments that were left.
Now those who ate were four thousand men, besides women and children.
And He sent away the multitude, got into the boat, and came to the region of Magdala.
